description.narrative:
Indus Consortium is the leading organisation of Fair Finance Pakistan, which is a coalition in preparation. Other NGOs participating in the coalition are: CIG (Center for Inclusive Growth), Channan Development Association, CPDI (Centre for Peace development initiative) and The Network for Consumer Protection. They will focus on commercial banks in Pakistan and their impact on livelihoods and(gender) inequality, by case studies and a policy assessment. They work closely together with Fair Finance Asia and will become part of FFA during 2021
The Fair Finance Asia Program (FFA) envisages to reduce the negative impact of national and cross-border bank investments in Asia on human rights, the environment and climate change, and to increase adequate financial services for pro-poor, inclusive economic development. The goal is to establish a sustainable financial sector in Asia, with financial sector institutions operating at national and regional level being more transparent and accountable and adhering toEconomic, Social and Governance (ESG)-criteria. FFA is funded by SIDA.
In Pakistan, this project is led by Indus Consortium (IC), which envisions a democratic and equitable society where all citizens enjoy equal economic, cultural and political rights.Indus Consortium works for local communities to enhance their resilience and participation in development.
In Pakistan, major decisions around investments are made by the global head offices of the IFIs. 90% of the total investment/ loaning goes to Pakistan government with 100% sovereign secure loaning whereas banks exclusively deal with clients and are often responsible to contributor to fuel in inequality.
Evidence suggests private loaning is preferred to state institutions like the military forexport of defense equipment . Lending priorities seem to exhibit extreme consumer liabilities instead of providing sustainable development i.e., Corporate insurance, farmers investment insurance etc. A deeper analysis suggests the primary motive for investment is to transfer finances through legal measures to oversees tax heavens such as the Cayman Island, Singapore, Dubai etc.

participating-org.narrative:
Indus Consortium - a collaborative platform of 3 humanitarian and development organizations i.e. Laar Humanitarian Development Program (LHDP), Doaba Foundation and HELP Foundation - is a manifestation of a joint force of the people living around Sindhu (Indus) River basin in Pakistan. The consortium represents the unity among various groups of different ethnic, linguistic and geographic features and their resolve to struggle for the development of the people around Indus River basin whose forefathers, in the ancient ages, had developed one of the most prosperous civilizations around the globe; remembered in history as Indus Civilization.
Indus Consortium envisions a democratic and equitable society where all citizens enjoy equal economic, cultural and political rights. Our mission is to works for local communities to enhance their resilience and participation in development.
